errorMessageActivationInvalidKey: Invalid activation key. This can happen if the account has already been activated.
formDescriptionServer: The URL of the database server as used in database.server of Germinate
formDescriptionDatabase: The name of the database as used in database.name of Germinate
httpErrorFourOO: Bad request. Server refused to respond.
httpErrorFourOThree: Forbidden. You cannot access this resource.
httpErrorFourOFour: Not found. Request returned no data.
httpErrorFourONine: Conflict. The request conflicts with existing data.
httpErrorFourTen: Gone. The resource is no longer available at this address.
httpErrorFiveOO: Internal Server Error. Something went wrong...
httpErrorFiveOOne: Not implemented. This resource is not implemented yet.
httpErrorFiveOThree: Service unavailable. Failed to send emails.
modalMessageResetPassword: Please note that username and email address may be the same.
modalCookiePolicyMessage:
This website's sole use of cookies (local storage) is to remember user settings between visits.

You can reject these cookies if you wish (and it won't affect your usage of the site) either by blocking them using the options in your browser, or by installing plugins such as the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on or Ghostery.

You may also find the following links useful:

  • ICO Cookie Regulations and the EU Cookie Law
modalTextRejection: Optionally tell the user why you rejected the request. Leave blank for no feedback.
pageAboutText:
Copyright © 2013-{year} Information and Computational Sciences, The James Hutton Institute

Germinate Gatekeeper is written and developed by Sebastian Raubach and Paul Shaw from the Information and Computational Sciences Group at JHI Dundee. Former members of the team include: Toby Philp.

While we firmly believe in collaborative science we appreciate there are times when data is private and needs to be kept that way. Because of this we have implemented Germinate Gatekeeper. Gatekeeper acts as an authentication mechanism for the Germinate system and allows restricted access to a Germinate database. Trusted users are provided with usernames and they can log in as required. Users can also change their passwords without manual intervention.

Germinate Gatekeeper uses a key derivation function for passwords. Any password you enter into this system is not available to administrators of this site so we cannot tell you your password if you have forgotten it or mail this information to you. If you have lost or forgotten your password we can temporarily set this to a new password which you can use to gain entry to your account to allow you to set a new password. To use this feature click on the {forgotPassword} link on the login page.
pageActivationMessageSuccessfulAwaitingA: Activation successful. An administrator has been notified and will review your request.
pageActivationMessageSuccessfulLetsGo: Activation successful. You can now use your Gatekeeper/Germinate account.
pageUsersTextGatekeeperAccess: Should this user be allowed to change their email address and password?
pageUsersTextDeleteUser: Click on the button below to delete this user account.
paginationCount: Showing {from} to {to} of {count} records|{count} records|One record
toastPasswordResetSuccessful: A new password has been sent
